                                             throws edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException
        Description copied from interface: UserManagerInterface
        Add one user to the system. The user will be saved into the database. All setup for the user will be done after the call completes. TODO: add initialization steps once known what the initialization steps are.

        Returns:
        User. The newly created user.

      • deleteContact

        public void deleteContact(edu.harvard.integer.common.user.Contact contact)
                   throws edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException
        Delete the Contact. The contact must not be associated with any user, service element or organization for the delete to succeed. If the contact is being used an IntegerException will be thrown with a error code of ContactInUseCanNotDelete.
        Specified by:
        deleteContact in interface UserManagerInterface
        Parameters:
        contact -
        Throws:
        IntegerException. - If the Contact is in Use with an error code of ContactInUseCanNotDelete.
        edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException
